issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify addGuestStudents(int, String) — i.e., a method that accepts an int (number of new guest students) and a String (reason). The solution implementation provides addGuestStudents(int) with only a single int parameter and no String parameter. This is a parameter/signature mismatch: students reading the UML/tasks will implement a two-parameter method, but the reference solution uses a different signature. This can confuse students using the solution as reference and may cause automated checks or comparisons against the solution to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's addGuestStudents method match the specification/UML: change its signature to addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason). Update the method body to increment numberOfGuestStudents using the int parameter and (optionally) handle, store, or log the reason string (e.g., print it or append to a reason field) so the parameter is not ignored. Alternatively, if the reason parameter is intentionally not needed, update the problem statement and UML to specify addGuestStudents(int) to keep artifacts consistent.

issues.description: The problem statement (and UML) specify a method addGuestStudents(int, String) that accepts a number of new guest students and a reason (String). The solution implementation provides addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) — the method is missing the String reason parameter. This mismatch in the method signature (parameter presence) breaks the one-to-one mapping students expect between the described API and the reference implementation and may confuse students about the required method shape and usage.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the method signature across artifacts. Either update the solution to implement addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason) (and handle or document the reason parameter), or change the problem statement and template to require addGuestStudents(int) if the reason is intentionally omitted. Prefer updating the solution to match the problem/UML so students see a consistent API: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason).
